fields.description:
Right now, the log location is hard coded in com.atlassian.jira.logging.JiraHomeAppender  to JIRA.HOME/log.

Changing this location requires major surgery to the log4j configuration as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/logging-and-profiling-938847671.html, which is error prone and make maintenance difficult.

There needs to be a -Djira.log.location=[path] option to override the location without all the overhaul to log4j.
fields.summary: JiraHomeAppender: Allow changing of the log location

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, the binary Linux installer takes a backup of the installation and home directories of Jira. 
There are admins who have separate jobs for this and don't need it to run as part of the upgrade process. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Give admins a way to disable backups of the home and installation directory when performing an upgrade of Jira. 
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: I want to disable backups of the home and installation directory when upgrading Jira via the binary installer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a user adds a labels to an issue, the history item created will show all previous labels on one side and those labels again + the new label on the other side. 
The same behaviour applies when a label is removed. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Create a history item for each label when it's added or removed. This behaviour is implemented properly for components. 
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Adding a label to an issue should create a history item with the new label only

fields.description:
The batch notification function is a nice faeture, but it needs more config options. I would like to have batch notification enabled on some projects, but not all. 

 

So, this is a suggestion to make this configrable on the project level.
fields.summary: Configure batch notifications per project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JQuery within custom field is not loaded while viewing JIRA issue with the custom field.

h3. How to Replicate
 # Create a custom field with following in the Description:
{code}
<script type="text/javascript"> $(document).ready(function() { console.log("Running script from custom field description."); }); </script>
{code}
 # Load an issue that has value set for this custom field:
 ** JIRA 7.13.1 - Script is triggered (JavaScript Console log: Running script from custom field description)
 ** JIRA 8.1.0 - Nothing relates to the script is logged in JavaScript Console log

If we edit the issue in JIRA 8.1 release, JQuery is triggered.

h3. Diagnosis
The behavioural difference is that Jira 7.13.1 eagerly loads "Edit issue screen" on each page view while 8.1.0 requests the data only after "Edit" button is clicked. This works in favor of Jira 8.1.0 since the initial page load is faster.

Tracing the HTTP requests between web browser and Jira site, the custom field description (JQuery) is associated to the response of Edit issue request (/secure/AjaxIssueEditAction!default.jspa). With the above behavioural changes, the description/JQuery associated to the custom field will only be loaded when "Edit" button is clicked in Jira 8.1.

h3. Suggestion
Provide the option to revert the behaviour, should users are not concern with the performance impact.
fields.summary: Option to load custom field's description in issue view

fields.description:
The team here liked the trial we did of the Batching Email Notifications however felt that the 10 minutes was too long, and want to know if a parameter could be added so that a number of minutes could be set.

I'd also be interested like "mention" certain actions could be excluded for the batch, for example Assign.
fields.summary: Parameters for Batching Email Notifications

fields.description:
In the list of issue types from the Help button next to Issue Type when creating an issue in Jira, there is text that says 

"JIRA can be used to track many different types of issues. The currently defined issue types are listed below. In addition, you can add more in the administration section."

The word "you" makes Jira users think they can add a new issue type. I suggest the text should say:

"Jira can be used to track many different types of issues. The currently defined issue types are listed below. In addition, your Jira administrators can add more in the administration section."
fields.summary: Doc fix for ShowConstantsHelp

fields.description:
h2. Current behaviour:

When seeing issues in the backlog view of Agile Boards, it is possible to Right Click > Split Issues but that will only copy the current issue into a new one and link them as split.
h2. Suggestion:

When attempting to split an issue that contains sub-tasks, users should be able to select sub-tasks to move along to the new split issue.
h2. Workaround:
 # To move incomplete or complete work done in sub-tasks, it is necessary to either move or clone them into the new parent task, one-by-one.
 # Bulk edit after filtering for all existing Sub-tasks that match the criteria
fields.summary: As an user, when splitting stories/tasks I would like to move arbitrary sub-tasks

fields.description:
Changing install directory and port affect import.

*Install paths from export source:*
 C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\ *JIRA*\data\attachments\insight\icons
 C:\Program Files\Atlassian\ *JIRA*\atlassian-jira\images
 *Port:* 8080

*Install paths from new instance:*
 C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\ *JIRA SQL*\data\attachments\insight\icons
 C:\Program Files\Atlassian\ *JIRA SQL*\atlassian-jira\images
 *Port:* 8081
  

*2 Issues:*
 # Custom images does not work, such as priority icons. The new instance looks for the images in the *JIRA* folder instead of *JIRA SQL.* Not sure if other paths are affected.
 # Custom images does not work on *Insight Asset Management* plugin. New instance looks for the images with old port number. This happens because, after import Jira suggests to change base url, and when we click change url by default it chooses the default port 8080 instead of the port selected on installation.

 
 *Workaround*: On new instance, make sure install path stays the same and to fix the port issue, change the base url in settings.
fields.summary: Changing install directory and port affect import to new instance.

fields.description: Batch email notification is disabled from System Settings. After disabling, customer are getting the pop up. Customer would like to disable "Too Many Emails?" pop upon first login.
fields.summary: Customer would like to disable pop up for Too Many Emails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Importing workflow using the jwb file does not set category of newly created status.


h3. Environment

Jira 7.13.X
Jira 8.X


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Export a workflow to a JWB file with status which does not exist in target instance.
# Import the workflow file to the target instance.
# Check the "Status" page and the newly created status will be displayed with "No category"


h3. Expected Results

Jira should show a screen asking user to map the newly created status with a category.


h3. Actual Results

Status created without any category.


h3. Notes

This bug prevents board from displaying issues which are set to the status with no category.


h3. Workaround

# Access "Status" page.
# Set a category for the status which does not have any category.
fields.summary: Importing workflow using the jwb file does not set category of newly created status.

fields.description:
Pasting images in Jira uploads the image to the issue and inserts a thumbnail into the editor. Pasting text inserts the copied text into the editor.

Pasting a mixed-media copy (text in addition to an image, graphic, or screenshot) results in only the text being inserted to the editor. At best, a placeholder filename is inserted for the image. In most circumstances, the image is simply dropped.

!image-2019-03-11-07-42-26-576.png|width=478,height=238!

Some users would like to select a passage of text with inline images and have the entire body plus the images paste into the editor.

 

*Workaround*: paste the passage, then copy/paste the images separately and individually
fields.summary: Allow mixed-media pastes (text + images) from clipboard in comments

fields.description: Developer asking to provide more information about remote caches / Jira specific remote caches details in the Atlassian Cache documentation.
fields.summary: Add more details about Jira remote caches to the Atlassian Cache 2 documentation

fields.description:
I update the "issue description" text in our Jira tracker a lot and each time it produces an email notification to all the "Assistance" entries. I also hit save a lot as Jira timeouts are basically killing my editing by resetting the form field.

My request here is practically very simple. Add another "Save and send notification" button to the "Save" button and don't send notifications when hitting "Save" (default button) at all.

This is implemented in Confluence already and Jira should just have the same feature IMHO.

 

Confluence data-aui-version 7.9.7

Jira data-aui-version 6.1.0, data-version 7.6.11

 

Workaround which I could be using (not tested):

Before I edit the issue description text, remove all the people listed in "Assistance", then make the edit, and add them again. Not sure if one gets a notification when being added the first time.

 

This ticket is related to the "chattiness ticket"
fields.summary: Jira email notification on issue description update

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When issues have large or many images in the Description, it will cause the information displayed in the Dashboard Gadget's Description column to be long and unpresentable. This makes it hard for users to read through the information of the Gadget.

There are some use cases which requires the Description as the information in Summary is not sufficient. The Description might need large or many images to illustrate the issue details.

h3. Suggested Solution
Hide or display as tags the images in the Description column of Dashboard Gadgets

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Hide or display as tags images in the Description column in Dashboard Gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If user2's current username is the same as user1's old username, granting a permission to user2 through *Single user* will incorrectly show that user1 has been granted the permission.

(i) This is a more problematic version of JRASERVER-65115

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 users in Internal directory as follows:
||username||Display Name||
|user1|User 1|
|user2|User 2|
 # Edit a Permission Scheme -> grant user2 a permission through *Single user* option
 (+) Notice that *User 2* is displayed
 # Rename user1 to _user123_
 # Rename user2 to *user1*

h3. Expected Behavior

The Permission Scheme still displays *User 2* as having the permission
h3. Actual Behavior

The Permission Scheme now displays *User 1* as having the permission
h3. Impacts

(i) There's no functionality impact because the permission is still granted correctly to user2 (User 2) who now has the username of user1. This can be verified by using Permission helper.

(flag) In other words, this is only a visual bug, but it may cause a lot of confusion to JIRA and/or Project administrators.
h3. Notes

This issue usually manifests when:
 # Multiple user directories are used and 1 or more users exist in more than 1 directory
 # Users have been renamed mostly for user migration purposes across user directories

(i) In JIRA db, table *app_user* looks somewhat like this:
||user_key||lower_user_name||
|user1|user123|
|user2|user1|
and table *cwd_user* now looks somewhat like this:
||username||Display Name||
|user123|User 1|
|user1|User 2|
(+) Table schemepermissions shows that the permission is granted correctly to User 2:
||perm_type||perm_parameter||
|user|user2|
fields.summary: Permission Scheme incorrectly shows that a different user has been granted a permission

fields.description:
This is to suggest adding a health check warning to allow Jira to report all disabled Jira bundled system plugins to avoid having unexpected functionality loss.
May of those plugins are essential and should always be enabled, among those is the *Atlassian HTTP Client*, *Entity property conditions*,  *JIRA Feature Keys* and others.

It is also useful to integrate this with current Jira support zip health checks summary to provide more help in troubleshooting issues.

This should mitigate plugins going disabled without being noticed by Jira admins.
fields.summary: Add health check warning for Jira bundled system plugins in disabled state.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As Jira has a limit of export up to only 1000 issues, when trying to export more than 1000 issues, the error :
{quote}'Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page. 
 You are not allowed to get a result set of more than 1000 results. Current search returns XXXX results' will be thrown.
{quote}
However, when using another language as a default language, this line is not correctly translated :
{quote}You are not allowed to get a result set of more than 1000 results. Current search returns XXXX results
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the default language as languages other than English.
 # Head to Issue Navigator and search for results with more than 1k issues.
 # Try to export the results as CSV.

h3. Expected Results

The error message below will be translated to the default language.
{quote}
Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page.

 You are not allowed to get a result set of more than 1000 results. Current search returns XXXX results' will be thrown.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
The error message is partially translated, for example : 
{quote}
Erreur {{"403 - Forbidden"}} rencontrée lors du chargement de cette page.

You are not allowed to get a result set of more than 1000 results. Current search returns 1681 results
{quote}

h3. Notes
Tested with French, Portuguese, Swedish.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When exporting more than 1000 issues, the 'Forbidden (403)' error message should be correctly translated to follow the default language.

fields.description:
*Background*

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for issues by Created Date, placeholder text uses incorrect format. This can cause frustration for users who are manually entering dates rather than selecting from the date picker. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Select *Issues* > *Search for issues* > *Basic search* > *More*
# Select *Created date*
# Note the date format in "from" and "to" fields is {{d-Mmm-yyyy}}
# Enter any two dates in this format
# Select Update

*Expected:* Jira will display issues created between the dates specified.

*Actual:* An error occurs. "Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy"."

h3. Workaround

Use the date picker to select dates, or enter dates in the format {{d/MMM/yy}} instead.

h3. Notes 

This was originally reported at JRASERVER-36905, but was closed/timed out.
fields.summary: When searching for issues by Created Date, placeholder text suggests using incorrect date format

fields.description:
Custom field of type Date Picker store year as 0018 instead of 2018 in the database

 *Environment:*
 - Jira 7.6.7
 - PostgreSQL 9.3

*Steps to reproduce:*
 - Create a custom field of type "Date Picker" and add to screens
 - Set the {{jira.date.picker.java.format}} format to: {{MM/d/yyyy}}
 - Create a new issue. Manually type the date in the date picker field as: 11/30/18

Run the following query in the Jira database, where 'Date Picker Field' is the field created in step 1
{code:sql}
SELECT id, issue, customfield, datevalue 
FROM customfieldvalue 
WHERE customfield=(SELECT id FROM customfield WHERE cfname='Date Picker Field')
{code}
*Observed Behaviour*
 datevalue in the database is stored as "{color:#FF0000}0018{color}-11-30 21:00:00"

*Workaround 1:*
 Change {{jira.date.picker.java.format}} format to {{MM/d/yy}}

*Workaround 2:*
 When creating the issue, use the date picker instead of manually typing the date
fields.summary: Custom field of type Date Picker store year as 0018 instead of 2018 in the database

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When exporting decimal values as a user using German language, the decimal value will be imported using "." instead of ",". 

However, when importing the CSV file, the values will run into some problem and will not be mapped in due to the incorrect decimal format. The importer is expecting the decimal value to be ",":
 !NumbCFCSVImport.png|thumbnail! 

The conflicting behaviors are leading to the problem with CSV import/export for users with languages with a different decimal format.

h3. Suggested Solution
The CSV import tool should do either 1 of the following:
* Export the values using the decimal format of the language used by the user
* Import the values using the standard decimal format "." despite the language used by the user

h3. Workaround 
Set the language to English when performing CSV import
fields.summary: Improve the CSV tool to allow decimal values to be imported/exported properly when using languages that have a different decimal format

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As indicated in the guide *[How to Configure an Outbound HTTP and HTTPS Proxy for JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-configure-an-outbound-http-and-https-proxy-for-jira-applications-247857187.html]:*
{quote}This Outbound Proxy configuration only works for HTTP and HTTPs request only. If you are trying to connect JIRA to a Mail Server (Gmail or Office365) or to an LDAP Server, this configuration will not work.{quote}

h3. Suggestion
The suggestion is to improve the LDAP server configuration so it works using the proxy like any other Jira function when an outbound proxy is configured.
fields.summary: Allow the LDAP server configuration to use outbound proxy settings

fields.description: Hello, I'm trying to do a lookup field that allows users to do a lookup on thousands of values and select one. I tried doing an import to a select field but it timed out. Is there a maximum limit to fields in a select list? Also, what kind of field would I need to use to hold thousands of values? Or is there another approach I could take that would allow users to find a predefined value instead of entering it on their own?
fields.summary: Field for thousands of values

fields.description:
As a result of an investigation done by [meta-inf-kft|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/vendors/4907/meta-inf-kft] about how the [Email this issue Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/4977/email-this-issue] uses Velocity Templates in Jira, it was discovered that the objects  from class *DefaultVelocityManager* might be causing memory leaks.
*DefaultVelocityManager* is currently part of our Jira API that can be used by Plugin vendors.

Turns out that Jira uses another object to handle Velocity templates: *JiraVelocityManager* which is safer to use, and is confirmed by Atlassian development team to be the recommended class to be used for working with Velocity templates.

Thus, we need to make the objects from the class *DefaultVelocityManager*  marked as deprecated so that our plugin vendors know that it is not supposed to be used any more.
fields.summary: Mark the objects from class DefaultVelocityManager as deprecated in Jira Java API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In specific situations with few roles defined in the instance and large amount of users assigned to them, removing actor from a specific role can take several seconds causing all incoming requests that require permission validation to hang.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Set up a vanilla Jira instance
 # Populate {{projectroleactor}} table to get ~100k results for the following query
{code:java}
SELECT ID, PID, PROJECTROLEID, ROLETYPE, ROLETYPEPARAMETER FROM projectroleactor WHERE PROJECTROLEID='10100' {code}
e.g. by:

 ## Generating ~100k users and assigning them to a single role (e.g. "Developers") in a single project, *or*
 ## Generating any amount of users, assigned to a single role in multiple projects so that users*projects=~100k
 # Remove a user from role

h3. Expected result

Action completes successfully and lasts up to 100ms
h3. Actual result

The action is executed for several seconds which in total includes:
 # Query to remove user from {{projectroleactor}} table:
{code:java}
DELETE FROM projectroleactor WHERE ID IN ('?'){code}
executed for several seconds.

 # Removing entries for specified role from {{projectRoleActorCache}}
 # Loading all users for specified role into cache by executing:

{code:java}
SELECT ID, PID, PROJECTROLEID, ROLETYPE, ROLETYPEPARAMETER FROM projectroleactor WHERE PROJECTROLEID='?{code}
which lasts for additional several seconds.

If the request is triggered several times, this can lead to *minutes* of system unresponsiveness as described in: [PS-40349|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PS-40349?focusedCommentId=18044069&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-18044069]
h3. Workaround
 # Add index on {{PROJECTROLEID}} column in {{projectroleactor}} table
 # Limit number of actors assigned to a given project role by:
 ## Archiving unused projects
 ## Splitting roles - e.g distributing users from large "Developers" roles as in example above into "Developers", "Testers", "IT Ops" etc.
 # Threshold
{code:java}
DELETE /jira02/rest/api/2/project/?/role/ {code}
requests or temporarily block them
 # Do not trigger removing role actors in peak hours and do not trigger removing same actor
fields.summary: Removing actor from project role can make Jira unresponsive

fields.description:
Slow JQL can create multiple performance-related  issues:
 * slow automation in JSD 
 * slow down issue creation, assignment, commenting etc   !https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&avatarId=51505&avatarType=issuetype! JRASERVER-68174 if dealing with webhooks listening for these events 
 * slow down [kanban board loading|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/kanban-board-loading-is-slow-performance-problems-800686285.html]

Just to name a few. 

It would be really cool if Jira ran a quick self-check on how long the JQL being saved to a board, webhook, filter, automation rule, to see if it violates the slow JQL rule of let's say 40 ms or something like that.
fields.summary: Validate and report if JQL is "slow" during any save function in the product

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As an administrator, I want to use a single fieldConfigurationScheme for new projects. However, when we have a large number of projects using a single fieldConfigurationScheme, it takes a very long time to associate a new project with the fieldCongurationScheme.

{{fieldConfigSchemeManager.updateFieldConfigScheme(...)}} takes as a parameter a list of associated projects (i.e. all of them), and updates the database for each project one-by-one (com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.FieldConfigContextPersisterWorker.store(....) ) also flushing the fieldConfigScheme cache each time.
h3. Environment
Large Jira Instance, >2000 projects, using a specific fieldConfigurationScheme

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create >2000 projects
 # create a fieldConfigurationScheme
 # associate all projects with the fieldConfigurationScheme
 # create a new project
 # set *DEBUG* for the *com.atlassian.cache.event* package
 # associate new project with fieldConfigurationScheme and see in the logs that *com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.FieldConfigContextPersisterWorker.configContextsBySchemeId* cache is flushed 2000 times

h3. Expected Results
Persistence is handled efficiently, i.e. only add the association for the new project instead of updating all associations, hence causing a single cache flush.
h3. Actual Results
{{*com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.FieldConfigContextPersisterWorker.store(....) *}} is called once for each project that's already associated with the same fieldConfigurationScheme.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Associating a field configuration scheme with a new project is very slow in large instances if the scheme is reused

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 During new ticket creation, if there is some validation rules failed. New fixed version will still be created.

h3. Environment

JIRA Version: 7.13.3, 8.0.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Prerequisites:
 ** A User with Resolve Permission
 ** Fix Version in Create Field Screen
 ** In Workflow Create Transition: add a 'Permission Validator' on Close Permission
 ** On Permission Scheme revoke all Close Permissions
 # Create a new ticket
 # Enter Summary and a new Fix Version
 # It shall trigger a validation error due to "*Creation blocked due to missing Close Permission*"
 # Left the issue creation page open.
 # Open a new tab and grant your account with Close Permission
 # From issue creation browser tab, where you have always the previous Create screen with failed validation, re-submit.
 # JIRA showing error mention fix version had been created.

h3. Expected Results

Fix version not created as validation failed
h3. Actual Results
Fix version created even when validation failed

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: During new ticket creation, if there is some validation rules failed. New fixed version will still be created.

fields.description:
Customer is developing an integrated solution with thier in house application have the requirement to change the author name in Jira to track all comments done by users in REST API resource. 
More details on the request: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/Possible-to-set-comment-author-through-REST-API/qaq-p/504216

Customer wants to be able to impersonate a user's account object from pre-authorised account using some library from user directory services.
fields.summary: Change author name from Rest API action

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When migrating issues from external trackers to Jira Server, it becomes very tedious to first have to create each of the issue statuses that you want to use before importing issues. For large environment that could have had several hundred different statuses in them it then takes a lot longer than it should to import this data correctly.
h3. Suggested Solution

Create REST API endpoint that allows users to create new statuses.  Currently the endpoint [GET /api/2/status|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.2.1/#api/2/status-getStatuses] will return all statuses in Jira.  But there is no corresponding POST verb that could be used to create these same statuses via REST.

h3. Why this is important

Makes it easier to migrate data into Jira. CSV importer is not able to create new statuses within Jira, and the lack of a REST API endpoint to create a new status means more manual status creation work for an admin. With such a POST or PUT endpoint and admin could create a little REST script to simply call Jira and tell it specifically what statuses should be valid within that site.
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Jira should be able to add or create new status via a REST API endpoint

fields.description:
It would be great to have the Version Report and Release Burndown Reports from Jira Software for Cross Releases in Jira Portfolio 3.0.

This would be extremely helpful if you try to scale agile.
fields.summary: Release Burndown Report and Version Report for Cross Releases

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * "Open issues" is the only filter that runs by default
 * Allowing the ability to change the default filter when viewing issues within will help customers stay organised

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Add functionality which allows custom filters to be set as the default filter

h3. Why this is important
 * In some instances, customers would like to have control over how issues are displayed when looking at a project

h3. Workaround
 * Create a custom filter and share that filter
fields.summary: Allow custom issue filters to be set as default filter for the issue screen on a project

fields.description:
Risk Matrix Add in

A name of a product is more beneficial than a number for our leaders to discuss risk.
fields.summary: Risk Matrix - Add In

fields.description:
Here's the problem. For that parent issue, reviewer sub-tasks are created. If a reviewer selects the "Attach files" option for his sub-task (as it appears under "Sub-Tasks" on the parent issue), the users seems to be prevented from doing so, even though the sub-task is a different workflow and no such Properties are set for it.
See attached Word document for further details.
fields.summary: Bug in Attach Files function when selecting for sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There were recent changes in the way Azure Jira templates default to versions when installing/upgrading. Most of our documentation suggests that the default version is the latest Jira version when in reality this was recently changed to the latest enterprise release version (Jira 7.13.0 at this specific time).
h3. Suggestion

Clearly document this change and add detailed instructions on how to upgrade an Azure cluster when dealing with a Jira 7.13.0 environment and trying to get to the latest Jira 8 environment.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/administering-jira-software-data-center-on-azure-938846973.html]

There's a Zero Downtime Upgrade limitation where you cannot upgrade across major versions, so going from Jira 7.13.0 to Jira 8.x.x needs to be detailed.

 

E.g. Zero downtime upgrade is not available when upgrading from Jira 7.x to Jira 8.x. You'll need to use one of the [regular methods|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER/Upgrade+methods]. If you're already on Jira 8.x, you can use zero downtime to upgrade to any later version.
fields.summary: Improve Azure Template documentation regarding versions/upgrades

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Drop down menu still appears after transition from Search Issue Screen
h3. Environment

7.5, 7.13, 8.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Issue tab > Search for Issues
 # Navigate over an issue and click on Actions button (...) on the right
 # A drop down menu will appear when you click and select "View Issue"
 # The drop down menu still appears after the issue page loaded
 # We will able to click  on other options on the menu

h3. Expected Results

The drop down should appear only once on Search Issue screen
h3. Actual Results

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Drop down menu still appears after transition from Search Issue Screen

fields.description:
When bulk transitioning issues, if comments are required by the transition, the bulk change screen still says that a comment is optional. I would suggest removing that default language to avoid confusion, since if the transition requires a comment it will allow the user to submit the bulk change but then the transition will fail.

 

Additionally, when using the JEditor renderer for the comment field, typing in the comment field during a bulk transition does not automatically check the box next to it like it does with the Wiki renderer. It would be nice if this functionality was the same across renderers.
fields.summary: Change Comment Functionality During Bulk Transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If we rename a user in Jira 8.2.0, add a renamed user in a project role, Jira won't allow the user to be removed from the project role. Based on our observation, adding the users in the project role inserts _jira_ (user_key) value of the user in the {{projectroleactor}} table 
 {{app_user}}
|id|user_key|lower_user_name|
|10803|jira|jira123|

{{projectroleactor}}
|id|pid|projectroleid|roletype|roletypeparameter|
|11209|10000|10002|atlassian-user-role-actor|jira|

however, removing the user, JIRA tries to look for _jira123_ which is the {{lower_user_name}} in the {{projectroleactor}} table. In the above example, since it was _jira_ (user_key) that has been inserted in the {{projectroleactor}} table, _jira123_ (lower_user_name) is nowhere to be found. Thus, JIRA does not allow this user to be removed from the project role.
h3. Environment

Jira 8.2.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user in Jira
 # Rename the user
 # Add the user in any project role
 # Attempt to remove the user from the project tole

h3. Expected Results

The user will be removed from the project role
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.
h3. Workaround

Execute the following REST endpoint to delete the user from the role: [Delete actor|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.2.0/#api/2/project/\{projectIdOrKey}/role-deleteActor]
{code}
/rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{roleId}?user={username}
{code}

h3. Note

Tested in JIRA 8.0 and the bug can't be reproduced
fields.summary: Users cannot be removed from the Project Roles if the user is renamed in JIRA 8.2.0

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is no official documentation for starting JIRA automatically or as a service on CentOS

The documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/starting-jira-automatically-on-linux-828796713.html is a general guide for Linux/Solaris and does not work on Red Hat 7.x based systems.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an official documentation for this. 
 
h3. Workaround 

Refer to the [Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/] post : 
*  https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Run-jira-as-a-service-in-linux/qaq-p/876850
fields.summary: Starting JIRA Automatically on CentOS

fields.description:
h4. Issue

* During support zip generation, UI reported an error "Your support zip is ready to download, but some errors occurred". The support zip was successfully generated, but no details of any error shown in the application log. 
 !Error.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Expected Result

* Jira should print more details about the error in the UI. 

h4. Actual behavior

* After turning on the debug logging for package 'com.atlassian.troubleshooting', the log indicated the support zip was successfully generated and the error happened because the 'limit file sizes' box was checked in the customize zip page.
{noformat} 
2019-05-30 09:05:08,161 support-zip WARN darrenv_admin 544x35189x1 nih67l 10.113.152.34,10.113.243.239 /rest/troubleshooting/latest/support-zip/local [c.a.t.stp.zip.ZipFileAppender] The file atlassian-jira-gc-2019-05-22_1808.log.0 was truncated to 25Mb in size.  If you need to include the whole file, untick the 'Limit File Sizes' option.
2019-05-30 09:05:11,353 support-zip INFO darrenv_admin 544x35189x1 nih67l 10.113.152.34,10.113.243.239 /rest/troubleshooting/latest/support-zip/local [atlassian.plugin] Saved Support Zip to: /var/atlassian/application-data/jira/export/JIRA_support_2019-05-30-09-04-59.zip
{noformat}

h4. Workaround

* Once uncheck the box 'limit file sizes' during support zip generation, no error was reported.
fields.summary: Need clear error message in the UI during support zip generation

fields.description: Since is it not possible to create views/filter that shows the parent/child relationship in the UI, it would be a great workaround if one could sort filter JQP by parent link, so a least the result is sorted by parent.
fields.summary: Sorting by "Parent Link"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an instance of Jira 7.13, or older (but newer than 7.0)
# Visit {{<jira-base-url>/images/icons/priorities/low.svg?format=PNG&size=large@2x}}. You will a priority icon.
# Upgrade to 8.0.0 or later
# Visit the URL again

h3. Expected Results
The new priority icon, same as {{<jira-base-url>/images/icons/priorities/low.svg?format=PNG&size=large@2x}}
!low-8.0.svg.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The priority icon from the previous version.
!low-7.13.svg.png|thumbnail! 

Icons are cached in {{<jira-home>/data/avatars}} and aren't invalidated during upgrade.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Priority icons in PNG format are inconsistent with SVG icons

fields.description:
As a manager of Jira issues, I sometimes need to include items in a Jira report that give me an overall picture of the status or attributes of linked objects.

As a manager, I need to be able to report inconsistencies such as why a Zendesk issue is Closed but the Jira issue is sitting in Open status.
 * Report on Zendesk issue number, status and other fields from a Zendesk linked issue. Allow a reference like Zendesk(key) to return a list of tickets to which the current object refers to.
 * Report on Bitbucket status such as whether commits or pull requests exist and how many of each. Allow a reference like Bitbucket(commits) which would return a list of commits related to the key of the current object.
 * Report on fields from a parent-linked object such as a Story referring to an Epic. Allow a reference like parent(status).
fields.summary: Reporting on Jira issues does not include linked items such as Zendesk details or Bitbucket related items

fields.description: It would be really useful if we could define resource types, (BA, DEV, Test...) set resource availability (6sp / 6hr per day, define days of week available) and plan sprints to a set capacity. - indicator highlighting remaining SP or Hr available in a set sprint
fields.summary: Capacity Planning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When open *Create* button in new tab, pasting image attachment In *Text Editing Mode* is not working.

h3. Environment
JIRA 8.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open *Create* button in new tab
# Select *Text Editing Mode*
# Paste a screenshot with *CTRL + V*
# Attachment will not be added
(i) Only impacting to *Text Editing Mode*

h3. Expected Results
Image attached accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
The image doesn't attach after we press *CTRL + V*, nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
Use visual editing mode
fields.summary: Pasting Image Attachment In Text Editing Mode Not Working If We Open Create Issue In New Tab

fields.description:
An inconsistency in how hostname of node's being resolved can cause disruption in cache replication, even though the {{cluster.properties}} have {{ehcache.listener.hostName}} being specified. 

The [Installing Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-data-center-938846870.html] should be improved by adding a note to ensure that each node's hostname is correctly set, and that all hostnames in the cluster resolve consistently (to avoid problems in cache replication).
fields.summary: Documentation note on the consistency of hostname being resolved in cluster

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using Firefox browser when a user goes to add an attachment in the comment using the visual text editor it shows up with a broken icon -
 !brokenarrow.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use Firefox (happens on Chrome but Chrome hides it)
 # Go to a ticket and add a comment with a file attachment (not image)

h3. Expected Results
Small green icon would show next to the attachment name
 !greenarrow.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
A broken icon is shown instead.

h3. Notes
This is due to the element adding placeholder context path /jira, you can see this when you inspect the element -
 !contextpath placeholder.png|thumbnail! 

The small green icon is shown properly after adding the comment or editing the comment in rich text editor, and when you go to the context path it uses the correct one -
 !working icon in comments.png|thumbnail! 

Editing the comment in Rich text editor shows it is fine as well -
 !editcommentworks.png|thumbnail! 

This is the same in Chrome where it has a placeholder context path of /jira, but Chrome chooses to hide the broken image or display it but at a much much smaller size.

h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Rich text editor doesn't show the small attachment icon

fields.description:
In the same way, we are able to see used Workflow per Issue Type in the view /secure/admin/ViewWorkflowSchemes.jspa, it would be practice to have :
 * the list of used Field Configuration per Issue Type in the page secure/admin/ViewFieldLayoutSchemes.jspa.
 * the list of used Screen Scheme per Issue Type in the page secure/admin/ViewIssueTypeScreenSchemes.jspa

When we have numerous configuration, we may gain time.

Vincent
fields.summary: Append Issue Type column in View Schemes

fields.description:
For some workflow implementation and customer requirements it would be good to implement the possibility of adding a global property to the entire workflow, which persists all over transitions.

For instance, I could add jira.permission.comment.projectrole to disable comments whilst in a transition but customer suggestion is to add the possibility to apply it to the entire workflow so that it can persist over all transitions.

Another possibility suggested by the customer would be to add the property directly in the transition, so that the transition could be used to allow/disallow comments.

As per customer comment: 


{code:java}
I would therefore like to propose that we can apply this property on a transition and the property would persist across transitions.  This way I could create an Anywhere to Itself transition called "Disable comments" that would apply this property another called "Enable comments" that would remove.  This, in a nutshell, is what I am requesting.
{code}
fields.summary: add workflow property which persists over all transitions

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

When there are multiple applications license on Jira instance (e.g. Jira Core and Jira Service Desk), "create new user" dialog has all "Application acces" checkboxes unchecked.
However, when there is only one, single application installed on Jira instance (either Jira Core, Software of Service Desk alone), Jira will automatically tick "Application access" field for this installed application:
 !image-2019-05-29-09-58-32-170.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2019-05-29-10-04-36-702.png|thumbnail!

As this is not documented anywhere, administrators are not aware of this behaviour and they unintentionally grant licenses to their users (this is more problematic for Jira Service Desk users as Customers doesn't need to have a license assigned to them and suddenly they become Agents although they are not supposed to).
h3. Suggested resolution

Modify [Create, edit, or remove a user|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/create-edit-or-remove-a-user-938847025.html] documentation so it does documents this behaviour as default and expected.
fields.summary: Update "Create, edit or remove a user" documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users with umlauts in their usernames cannot be deleted or displayed in Jira user management.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to User management and create a new user
# Create a user with full name _Dörte Henning_ and username dörte
# After the successful creation of the user, try viewing the user's profile by clicking the full name link
# Try deleting the user via UI via {{Delete user}} action

See  [^username_problem.mov] to demonstrate the issue

h3. Expected Results
* Either do not allow the creation of users with an umlaut in usernames, or 
* viewing or deleting for such users can be done

h3. Actual Results
User profile cannot be seen and the user cannot be deleted.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Users with umlauts in their usernames cannot be deleted or displayed in Jira user management

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour

When a node is locked for a foreground re-index, the node enters an ERROR state but remains part of the cluster. This causes Cluster Cache Replication to halt and triggers this HealthCheck error. For instances with distributed management, it may cause undue alarm.
h3. Suggested Behaviour

This error should in this specific case be replaced with a warning as the node was explicitly requested by an administrator to be temporarily unavailable. 

This new warning should also present the progress URL from the TaskDescriptor and, if possible, inform the administrator of what administrator or utility locked the node for reindexing.
h3. In addition..

The [Cluster Cache HealthCheck documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/healthcheck-cluster-cache-replication-738722400.html] should be updated to reflect that a node locked for reindex is a common cause for this error.
fields.summary: Improve Cluster Cache Replication HealthCheck to recognise nodes locked for re-indexing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Server*. Using *Jira Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72153].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition
Several past cases have been reported of Jira admins trying to use a user custom field value or a group custom field value to set a project permissions such as 'Create Issue' or 'Browse Project'.  The intention of the admin here is to only allow the possible users in that custom field options to have that specific permission.   This does not work though for these specific permissions, because in order to evaluate these permissions the issue has to already be created in Jira.  These custom fields would have to have a value set within them on an issue already created.  The potential values of that field are not valid as a means to impose a permission grant on those specific permission options.  In the case of creating issues, it can't possibly work because the issue is not created yet.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the way permission schemes work and edit the screens there in to prevent admins trying to set permissions that can never possibly be valid within Jira:
#  This could be done by specifically removing 'user custom field value' and 'group custom field value' from the objects that cannot possibly honor their hypothetical values yet.  We know this includes at least create issue and browse project, but there could be others in play here as well. 
# Another solution could be to change the current behavior of the browse project permission when granted to the 'user custom field' and 'group custom field' when these 2 fields are not set to any value. In this case, instead of allowing any user to view the issue, no one should be able to view the issue until these fields are set.

h3. Why this is important
Lots of admins in Jira have attempted to configure this because Jira allows it, But can't possibly honor it.  It causes high levels of frustration and angry users to have Jira let you do something that it has no expectation of being able to do.
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26659
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30783
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-66317
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21613
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30783
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/JIRA-Bug-with-Group-Custom-Field-Permission-Settings/qaq-p/734856

h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Jira Permission schemes should not allow you to attempt to configure nonsensical permission states

fields.description:

Currently, Jira's look and feel customizations are not reflected in the Jira Mobile app as documented in https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/jira-software-mobile-app-966063511.html

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for the look and feel customizations in the app

fields.description:
In a scenario where you have a few contexts for a given custom field of type _Select List (single choice)_, as an example:

Context 1
 - Project: Default
 -- Values: 1, 2, 3

Context 2
 - Project: MJ
 -- Values: MJ1, MJ2, MJ3

Context 3:
 - Project: GS
 -- Values: GS1, GS2, GS3

Create a new project with shared configuration and select project "GS" for example.
h3. Requested behaviour:

In the newly created project, the values of the custom field should be the same as "Context 3" since the project was created based on project "GS"
fields.summary: Creating a project with shared configuration should also copy custom field contexts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If Jira is configured with multiple user directories, single user which exist in multiple user directories, each of the identical username has a different email address and someone tried to search using with email of the user (from lower user directory, Jira will only display the user detail from the topmost directory.


h3. Environment

* Jira 8.1
* Jira 7.13.0
* Jira 7.13.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a username *test* with email of *atlassian123@gmail.com* in Internal Directory.
# Create another username with *test* with email of *supporttest@gmail.com* in a LDAP directory.
# Connect Jira to the LDAP directory.
# Move the LDAP directory to be above Internal Directory.
# Access *Users* page and search using *atlassian123@gmail.com* keyword.


h3. Expected Results

Jira shows either:

# No result or
# Some hints that user with the email address is hidden because it's in lower user directory.


h3. Actual Results

Jira shows the detail of identical username from top most directory.


h3. Workaround

If admin required to view the detail of the user from different user directory, reorder the user directory to make the user directory where the affected user belongs to as the highest user directory.
fields.summary: Jira displays incorrect result while searching for users from multiple user directories

fields.description:
This is a regression to [JRASERVER-61328|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61328]

{quote}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61328].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The "connecting JIRA to SQL Server" documentations do not mention the autoCommit parameter in the JDBC URLs. This parameter is needed to prevent deadlocks as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlock-when-running-jira-with-sql-server-283640022.html and so it should be a required configuration in JIRA's dbconfig.xml.

h3. Suggested Solution
Modify the documentation to include {{autoCommit=false}} parameter by default:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/connecting-jira-to-sql-server-2012-683541742.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008
{quote}

Note: 
Jira Server 
For Jira DC it might cause issues when starting the second node as mentioned on this KB [Second node fails to start due to read timed out accessing dbo.clusteredjob with MS SQL Server database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Second+node+fails+to+start+due+to+read+timed+out+accessing+dbo.clusteredjob+with+MS+SQL+Server+database]
fields.summary: Documentation for SQL Server should include setting the autoCommit parameter in JDBC URL

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, users will be required to login to Jira to display wallboard from Jira. Some users would like feature to be able to access specific URL to directly view the wallboard without the need to login to Jira. 

This also prevents any security issue where users do not have to login to random devices to display the wallboard.


h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a unique URL for wallboard so users can access it directly and view the content of the wallboard.


h3. Workaround 

it's possible to provide anonymous access to the dashboard by:

# Provide anonymous access to the project where the issues in the dashboard belong to: [Allowing anonymous access to your project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0713/allowing-anonymous-access-to-your-project-964983462.html]
# Edit the dashboard permission and allow "Everyone"/"Public" to be able to view the dashboard.
fields.summary: Allow users to enable anonymous access to wallboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When configuring JIRA indexing, Service Properties Will Be Overwritten (Cleared)

h3. Environment
Tested on JIRA 8.1, 7.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a JIRA Instance
# Configure *Index Recovery* set *Enable index recovery* to *ON* in *localhost/secure/admin/IndexAdmin.jspa* page
# Access to *Services* configuration page *localhost/secure/admin/ViewServices!default.jspa*
# Look for *JIRA Index Snapshot Service*
# Edit it, set *Number of backupsp to retain* to a number for example *5*
# Update it
# You will see properties showing *backupCount:5*
# Access to *index recovery* page and click *Edit Settings*
# Set the *Schedule* or *Interval* and *Update* it
# You will see *backupCount:5* gone missing in services configuration page now

h3. Expected Results
Services properties should retain unless we disable the service

h3. Actual Results
Properties cleared after we update it via *Index recovery* page


h3. Workaround
-
fields.summary: When configuring JIRA indexing, Service Properties Will Be Overwritten (Cleared)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sending a support request using Troubleshooting and support tools shows that "Support request submitted!" on the UI although it actually fails because of attachment filesize limit.

h3. Environment
Jira 7.9.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Troubleshooting and support tools.
# Click on "Get Help" tab.
# Send in a support request
(i) Ensure that the log filesizes are huge (100mb++).
# Wait for progress bar.

h3. Expected Results
* It fails to send a support request to {{getsupport.atlassian.com}} and shows an error message on the screen.

h3. Actual Results
* We see the UI telling us that Support request submitted. 
* !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* Issue is not created in {{getsupport.atlassian.com}}

h3. Notes
In the logs, we see
{code}
2019-05-23 21:14:23,386 support-request ERROR lenard 1269x675x1 9iit55 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/view/create-support-request/execute [c.a.t.stp.request.CreateSupportRequestTask] Sending support request
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPSendFailedException: 552-5.2.3 Your message exceeded Google's message size limits. Please visit
552-5.2.3  https://support.google.com/mail/?p=MaxSizeError to view our size
552 5.2.3 guidelines. c142sm50986538pfb.171 - gsmtp

	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.sendWithMessageId(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:225)
	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:162)
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.stp.salext.mail.AbstractSupportMailQueueItem.send(AbstractSupportMailQueueItem.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.stp.salext.mail.SupportRequestMailQueueItem.send(SupportRequestMailQueueItem.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.stp.salext.mail.AbstractMailUtility.sendSupportRequestEmail(AbstractMailUtility.java:74)
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.JiraMailUtility.sendSupportRequestEmail(JiraMailUtility.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.stp.salext.mail.AbstractMailUtility.sendSupportRequestMail(AbstractMailUtility.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.stp.request.CreateSupportRequestTask.createSupportRequest(CreateSupportRequestTask.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.stp.request.CreateSupportRequestTask.lambda$call$0(CreateSupportRequestTask.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.stp.request.CreateSupportRequestTask.call(CreateSupportRequestTask.java:77)
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.stp.request.CreateSupportRequestTask.call(CreateSupportRequestTask.java:35)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}
* If this is the case, then Jira should let the user know to use {{https://transfer.atlassian.io/}} to send the files.

h3. Workaround
* Login to {{getsupport.atlassian.com}} to confirm that ticket has been created.
fields.summary: Sending a support request using Troubleshooting and support tools gives incorrect confirmation if filesizes are huge.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Log can be flooded with {{[lucene-stats]}} entries when using {{TemporaryIndexProvider}} Jira service.

h3. Expected Results

Closing an index writer from a {{RAMDirectory}} should not trigger printing {{[lucene-stats]}} as closing this index is done frequently and is a cheap operation. 

h3. Actual Results

The following log can appear frequently when service: {{TemporaryIndexProvider}} is used.
{noformat}
INFO [lucene-stats] flush stats: snapshotCount=4, totalCount=4, periodSec=0, flushIntervalMillis=5, indexDirectory=null, indexWriterId=com.atlassian.jira.index.MonitoringIndexWriter@78f90d8b, indexDirectoryId=RAMDirectory@6f88c034 lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SingleInstanceLockFactory@14369056
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Add "com.atlassian.jira.index.MonitoringIndexWriter" custom package to logging and profiling in JIRA and set the debug log level to ERROR. 
That is until JIRA is restarted. To get the setting permanent, it'll need to be added to log4.properties file as per this article:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/logging-and-profiling-861253813.html
Note that this log should be turned back to default when this issue is fixed. 
For any other type of index this log provides valuable statistics allowing to detect performance problems with indexing.
fields.summary: Frequent lucene-stats in logs triggered when closing temporary index (RAMDirectory)

h3. Issue Summary

Jira locked Development field name shows i18n key as it is. Other entities can be affected:
 * custom field name and description (table: customfield)
 * issue type name and description (table: issuetype)
 * field configuration scheme name (table: fieldconfigscheme)
 * field configuration name (table: fieldconfiguration)
 * field layout item description (table: fieldlayoutitem)
 * project role name and description (table: projectrole)
 * search request query (table: searchrequest)

h3. Environment
 - Jira 8.2.0
 - Not reproduced 7.13.0, 8.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Build Jira with installer
 # Move _Jira Administration > Issues > Custom fields_
 # Check locked "Development" field

h3. Expected Results

Field name show "Development".
 Field description show "Development Summary Field for Jira Software use only".
h3. Actual Results

Field name show "devstatus.customfield.development.name".
 Field description show "devstatus.customfield.development.desc".
h3. Notes
 - When search issue with development field, need to use i18n key.
{code:java}
devstatus.customfield.development.name[pullrequests].open > 0{code}

 - {{Approvals, Organizations, Customer Request Type Custom Field, Request Participants}} in Jira Service Desk field also have same issue.
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-24 at 18.05.06.png|thumbnail!
 - JIRA Portfolio Custom Fields also affected by this
 !jpo.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some Jira entities created when installing applications show i18n keys instead of translated values.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In LexoRank Managment UI, (System > Lexorank management.), there is a Rank Status column, the "Next Rebalance" status "scheduled" is confusing / unintuitive.

!image-2019-05-23-17-16-13-353.png|thumbnail!

 

According to [Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/managing-lexorank-945111766.html] the Next Rebalance will be scheduled, when Status is "Warning".
|Status|
|OK|the rank length is in a healthy state|
|Warning|a rebalance has been scheduled|
|Critical|an immediate rebalance has started, you are approaching a state where rank operations will be disabled|

*When is a re-balance job is triggered or required?*
 When the the ranking value splits in 2 different buckets.
 The number of characters on the lengthiest rank field on the table is what defines the need for a rebalance operation, and here are the thresholds:
 * 50 characters: a rebalance operation is scheduled to occur in 12 hours;

 * 100 characters: a rebalance operation is immediately started;
 * Issues with > 254 characters RANK can't be ranked.

But we also have this on the documentation: 
|Next rebalance|
|Scheduled| - once the next threshold is reached, a rebalance will be scheduled|
|Immediate| - once the next threshold is reached, a rebalance will start immediately|
h3. Suggested Solution

We need better "Next Rebalance" statuses, when Rank Status = OK. then "Next Rebalance" Status should be something like "Not scheduled”, so we can make this message more intuitive, less confusing for admins.

Also, Additionally documentation may be provided/updated to clarify on the different balancing statuses available, and what are the threshold / limits that will trigger the re-balance.

Or an information dialogue that the admin can hover a mouse over to learn more about what the status means.
fields.summary: Lexorank Management "Next Rebalance" status is confusing

fields.description:
h3. Definition/Use Case
It would be great if we can exclude failing Bamboo plans from issue development panels. But to be more precise, we only need this for a few specific Bamboo plans. We create and test Bamboo jobs in a separate experimental plan und during this process, the corresponding builds may fail a lot (which is OK). However, since these builds also use our main source repositories (and their branches), the failing experimental plan is shown as a link in Jira issues. Furthermore, such failed builds lead also to warnings for releases that include the corresponding Jira issues.

h3. Suggestion
To have an option to configure what data will be displayed in the issue development panel.
fields.summary: Ability to Filter Out What will be Displayed in the Development Panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When logging in from the {{secure/ForgotLoginDetails.jspa}} page, users remain on this page after authenticating into the application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the login page under {{secure/Dashboard.jspa}}
# Click on the *Forgot password* link
# Click on the *Log In* button at the top right of the page.
# Input your credentials and login


h3. Expected Results

You would be directed to the dashboard like you are on the {{login.jsp}} page

h3. Actual Results

You are logged in but remain on the {{secure/ForgotLoginDetails.jspa}}


h3. Notes

I'm not sure if this is how it was designed or if it's a Java session ID issue.
This is reproducible on Jira 7.12.x, 7.13.x, 8.0.x and 8.1.0 versions

h3. Workaround

Login from any other page to not see this page.
fields.summary: Logging in under secure/ForgotLoginDetails.jspa keeps you on this page after authenticating

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When I have two Jira instances application linked and a user adds a gadget to a dashboard, duplicate gadgets with the same name appear (for example Filter Results) . These are labeled *Local* and *External* depending upon whether they are from the local Jira instance or the application linked instance. 

*This causes confusion for users:*
* They don't know the difference between Local and External, or do not notice
* The gadget list loads external gadgets by default, so it's easy to select the wrong one by mistake
* The gadget name does not make it clear that the results are from a different Jira instance
* Once on a dashboard, the only way to modify the header is by updating the filter it uses
* If I have more than two Jira-to-Jira application links, it is impossible to tell at a glance which gadget belongs to which Jira instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Instead of "External," list the name of the application link for the external application. 

Include the name of the application link in the title of the gadget.
 
h3. Workaround 

Users can be coached to select "Show XML Link" to verify the URL of the instance they're linking from.
fields.summary: Differentiate among Local and External gadgets when two Jira instances are linked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira using double encoding for character in referrer URL when loading dashboard
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Refresh Jira dashboard while recording network traffic in browser (developer tools)
 # Once the page is loaded, search for "up_rendering" text in browser network console
 # Click on one filtered request and observe double coded characters:
 !image-2019-05-22-16-34-34-309.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Jira doesn't double encode the characters, which means that space character is encoded as "%20".
h3. Actual Results

Jira double encodes chracters, which means that "%20" appears as "%2520" (as "%" characters corresponds to code "%25").

 This is also visible on this piece of URL extracted from the HAR file:
{code:java}
...rules=%257B%2522rules%2522%253A%255B%255D%257D&up_renderingContext=&up_keys=&up_itemKeys=&up_username=&url=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A7810%2Fjira781%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin%3Aactivitystream-gadget%2Fgadgets%2Factivitystream-gadget.xml&libs=auth-refresh
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira using double encoding for characters in referrer URL when loading dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pasting a block of text that contains any tabs ('\t') will make the editor ignore line breaks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit any field in Jira that uses the Rich Text Editor - for example, Comment and Description;
 # Paste the following while using the "Visual" mode:
{noformat}
1	User A
2 User B
3	User C
{noformat}
# Note that, even though the second line doesn't have a tab, it will still paste with no line breaks;

h3. Expected Results
Line breaks should be interpreted regardless of other characters.

h3. Actual Results
Line breaks are ignored and have to be manually inserted.

h3. Notes
If the same block of text above has columns separated with spaces, this doesn't happen.

h3. Workaround
Use the "Text" mode and, to preserve the spacing set by tabs, paste the text into a ''\{noformat}' macro.
fields.summary: Pasting tab-separated text ignores line breaks in the editor's Visual mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you have a project in Jira that allows anonymous user access to things like commenting, the activity stream can become very full with anonymous user comments.  This makes it much harder to find actions or comments from other authenticated users.  The filtering options in the activity stream gadget do allow you to filter upon a username.  However since Anonymous users do not technically have a username, there is actually no way to limit or restrict those unauthenticated user's actions from the stream

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful if the activity stream had some way to filter out for anonymous users.  

h3. Why this is important
Many users find that anonymous comments are not as important to them as the actions of users with accounts.  This can help to make the activity stream full of more useful, directed information.

h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Activity stream filter should be able to hide actions of anonymous users
